com.zhukovsd.graphs.dual

Class DualGraph<E extends EmbeddedVertex<E>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zhukovsd.graphs.Graph<DualVertex<E>>
      • com.zhukovsd.graphs.dual.DualGraph<E>

  • public class DualGraph<E extends EmbeddedVertex<E>>
extends Graph<DualVertex<E>>
    Every vertex of dual graph lays inside of corresponding face of outer graph. In contrast to classical dual graph in graph theory, this implementation does not have vertex for outer face of outer graph. Outer graph must be embedded in order to have faces. Dual graph on wikipedia.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DualGraph

        public DualGraph(EmbeddedGraph<E> outerGraph)
        Create and fill graph. Create vertex for every outer face in outer graph, create 2 directional edges for every pair of adjacent faces in outer graph.
        Parameters:
        outerGraph - graph faces of which contains new dual graph's vertexes

        Parameters:

        Returns:
